html:
1.17.23  4:49 pm   1.16.23  5:41 pm I wasn't the original asker of this question...but do you think in these types of situations, the time sig is just about what is easiest to write/read on a page?

      Or is there a feel difference? Like, as a drummer, would you play differently for a song that was notated as 3/4 vs 6/4? 


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202301161741

1.16.23  5:41 pm   thoughts on 6/4 time? someone told me no one makes songs in 6/4

      a lot of people do it without knowing it. they'll put 3/4 on the page and have tiny bars when it really might have been better to say 6/4. there's no reason 'we wish you a merry christmas', 'happy birthday', 'you make me feel like a natural woman', and trillions of other popular songs from every generation wouldn't really be better off saying 6/4 on the page. or, depending on the tempo, be converted to 6/8 or even written as 4/4 and put everything in triplets. a lot of different notation options for songs in 3-feels. But songs with a 4-feel tend to just use 4/4 because it's all groups of 4 within groups of 4 within groups of 4, so 4/4 will always fit. I'd say about 20% of songs use some kind of 3-feel, and within that you're going to have a million different ways of writing the same thing. so those time signatures (6/4, 6/8, etc) would appear less common, but they are used for the same type of music which again i'd say comprises at least 10% of music from all generations

html:
11.23.22  3:08 pm   Can you post the script for Perfect?

sure
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/perfect.html
(2 characters sitting cross legged on opposide ends of the small curb island shown here with the patches of brick on either end)
(2 cars are shifting between spaces in a way described)


1. what's going on here?
.. avoidance wars. each driver is trying to avoid eye contact with the other person.
do they know each other?
  nope
do they want to know each other?
no way


(some alternate camera angle of the same thing still going on)




do you think we should introduce them?
........... i think that's a great idea


........... but i think          everyone is scared of
[both] "What Might Happen".

(at this moment, the 2 cars seem to shut down and peter out, slightly coasting a bit further in the direction of their last move)


(1)  ... (slightly perplexed) 'hmh, they got tired out.'
(2)        (eyebrow raise, slightly wearily/warning tone), 'they probably had a Big Day yesterday and the day before and the day before')
1: have you ever had a Big Day?
2:  (pause) ................... my whole Life is big. (quickly looks to the side) 'oh, here's street cleaning'.
(the street cleaning vehicle sort of comes through the parking lot at an angle, and weaves between the two cars that were playing the game)

......... which, makes me immediately want to ask,
[both] "Was the Street Dirty"
2:  (immediately) no i don't think so, (&) i can never seem to remember. (1 nodding) (2 speaking pretty quickly) i try to remind myself to TAKE NOTE of whether or not the street's dirty, BEFORE the street cleaning car comes around and cleans it. ....  but i always forget, and then the car comes, and i'll never know.

1 ...... sounds like you need a way to  predict the past

(they look at each other)
2 (nods) 'yeah'
1: (with 2 nodding along) find out how to predict when the current moment is gonna be the past.
and then check up on certain details because you know you won't be able to access them anymore.
(both immediately get up, and start looking around)
1 (immediately) "is one of these cars yours?"
2. yep. i just bought all of them
1... how'd you do that?
2.... they ahh, .. there was an auction.
1. (blankly ?)
2.   online. i didn't have to go, i just sat here and now i own all these cars. .............. except for         those two.       (pause) ....... those are self owning cars.
1:   ok, well can we drive some of these other ones?
2......... ahhhhh, nope, those are all self driving.

1. ok, well then, ....... can one of them drive us somewhere?
2. Sureware.  ... i mean,   ,,  sure, where?
1.  i dunno, to the moon and back?
2. .... (disappointment voice) oww, i think that might be out of range for some of these cars.
1.how about down the street?

2... (thinkin)...... sure. if you can figure out which way that is.

(some hypnotic shot maybe zooming backwards (split screen or something?) bothways down the street, .. something hypnotic which makes both directions seem equivalent




1. do the cars know?
2.  the cars,.......... (thinks for a moment),.... these cars know everything, which   unfortunately cancels out and, so they know nothing.
1.(they) KNOW nothing?
2 (immediately corrects self) FEEL nothing.
1. (ah.)
2. they know everything. .........             so they don't care.
1. (i see.)
2. ...... so it means don't ask for their opinion.
1. right. so [immediately pulls out some kind of megaphone device, but less annoying. something with like, just some nice delay/reverb on it, and a nice clean shout] WHERE DO YOU WANNA GO?
2. welllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll, let's think about what our options are.
(they both go and sit atop the business names sign)
1. (immediately, a bit soft, confidatory) you know just realized, we could actually go anywhere, and now i'm feeling kind of overwhelmed.
2. (immediately, same tone) i know what you mean. .............. is there anywhere you've been before?
1........ yes,    i've been somewhere before.
2. well can we go There?
1. i don't remember where it was
2. oh.


2.   was it here?
1. yes.
2. oh

2. are we there y-
1 (smile)  Welcome.  yes, we're here.
2. i'm excited about that.
[immediately huge rush of traffic on main road, surrealistically fast, in both directions]

1. where do you think all those people are going?
2. (slow, blank stare forward) .. away. (quickly corrects self, and looks at the cars) no it's ah,
1. (also looking) ....... half of them.
2. yea, ... .....no, it's (they both suddenly realize)
both: "all of them are going away,   half the time"
2. and the other half of the time they're ........   coming back?
1. no.  .. they came back first. .. then went away.
2. .. right.

2. from where?
1. i think it might be a loop... (looking)
2....no, it couldn't be. this road has no curvature whatsoever.
1. yes, but they could be making a series of angular turns.
2. that's right, good point. (show diagram, with vague subconscious allusion to right angles and points, but not too much)


2. (looking) everyone around here seems pretty driven.
1. that's just a sign of the times.  ...... 5 minutes ago, no one was going anywhere.
2. i remember.
1. now all that's changed

2.....  except we're still here.
1. i just noticed that.


2.  how is that possible?




1. ... it must be because of this sturdy commercial signage fixture upon which we are perched
2. ... (smirk) "sit on a sign, ... (looks at camera) feelin fine (looks back at 1)"............. "that's my motto"
1. (stares back at 2).............  "my motto is different than that".
2. "i understand that"

1.(megaphone again) SHALL WE AMOUNT TO SOMETHING
2. well how do you propose we do that?
(the flow of cars slowly but fairly quickly peters out, like when the rain stops pretty quickly.)

1 (looking up)........ (pointing) we could go up.
2. i don't know how to do that.
1. (looking up again)
2. that's the one thing, i've never learned how to do.


2. i can do everything besides that.

1. can you go .... to the side?
2. i'm pretty sure i can
1. but just not up.
2 right,yep. no.
1. (immediately, climbing down) "these places--"  "this has gotta be fictional" (looking at the business names on the sign
(looking around, to the store fronts, comparing to the sign, ... pensive look, they both have)
2..... no, it's real.

(a singular car drives by)

1.   .......... is there any way to test that?
2. ............. try to make up something better.
1. ......................................... honestly, i would have spelled this with more 'R's.  (looking at one of the business names)
2. (immediately reveals another R, of the same font, from pocket or behind back or something) "here"
1. (slaps it onto the sign) (looks at it, ponders it)  .......... (takes it off and hands it back) "nah".......   "i see what you mean."
(they both go into statue mode (like the walking budget got cancelled) and then begin sliding back and forth with hand slider motion on the side walk, not going through each other. ))
1. everything is perfect. [end]

f2like, let's say you're driving along, lo de da de doo, [f1: right]  minding your own business, and you're about get to the restaurant, and then you're there, and bam, it's a different restaurant.
f1:  .......... yep

f1: uh huh.

f1: i think it happens constantly.

here
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202112281559

12.28.21  3:59 pm   in when I get older, you say when you're older you'll be more truthful. around 3 years later, meaning you're 3 years older, you say "today I woke up telling the truth" in more than a dream. therefore, you're older and more truthful. was this intentional? 

      it was intentional to make each of the songs like that. but not for any reason related to each other. i have a habit of singing about the truth, because it...... seems so real.
But if you look at the 'when i get older song', you can trace the reasoning differently. the reason 'truthful' is there, is it's clearly an answer to the previous lines about being a liar. And the reason the word 'liar' is there is, clearly, it's what follows naturally after the line "when i get younger". Because obviously no one's gonna get younger. so obviously if you say you've gotten younger then you're presumably a liar. And the way the "when i get younger" line comes about, is, just a simple songwriting tactic of taking the already established first line ("when i get older") and choosing the natural alternative options. older --> younger. So you can see, the whole existence of the word 'truthful' in that verse is clearly the result of a very logical chain of songwriting best-practices

10.26.21  5:12 am   are you avoiding labeling your music as "pop" because you're afraid that people will just discard it with a "I don't like pop"?

      i actually do label my music as "pop" when i send it to stores, because i write it with the intention of making it as good as i can. and i believe that is the most important feature of pop music: to be really good. 1.10.19  4:40 pm   How did the 'La de da de da de da de day oh' song come to be? It sounds so good to me! It probably was similar to the process of other songs, but I'm asking because, in my opinion, it really stands out, and I want to know more about it.

     this may sound boring and technical but i wrote some of it on a writing session, then wrote a bit more of it on a writing session, and then finally wrote the remainder of the song during a writing session. that's the short story. the long story is, i was doing a writing session many many years ago after many years of not doing writing sessions. actually it felt like i had never done a writing session before, it had been so long. i know i did many years before that, but it seemed so far away and i'm not quite sure how i ever did it. too long ago to remember really, and the world had surely changed since then, mine and everyone else's. so i was doing something which i think might have been totally new, i was just writing. not in the recording thing, not trying to record and write at the same time, just writing. like on paper, and i had 1 instrument to play along to what i was singing, and weirdly it was an unplugged bass. which doesn't quite make sense but it was a quiet room and i was just using it to indicate chords. not play chords, but just play the bass notes to indicate chords. so a few things were written on that session, including a thing that looked like this. you may mostly recognize this verse, sort of mostly. but the chorus it goes to on this page (not shown) is completely different, and wraps up to a surprise twist ending very quickly, making it a probably less than 1 minute piece called, presumably, 'in the snow.' the snow not really being the chorus, the snow being the twist ending. so that's 'in the snow.' fast forward maybe 3 and a half years. i am getting my life togther and going through the stacks and stacks of writing sessions i've done over the years, and getting it all organized and doing writing on them, for days and days and days and days and weeks, a many months long writing-only period i call 'writing tare' when i worked only on writing for almost a year, and not starting any new ones, just updating/continuing/finishing/fixing on existing songs and fragments. very early on in this process, around september 2012, i took a look at 'in the snow,' made some small adjustments to the verse to make it stronger, the pre-chorus got changed from 'i'm gonna count to 3' to instead 'i'm gonna write a song'. therefore the old chorus didn't make sense (something about counting to 3 i assume) ditched it and wrote a brand new much brighter stronger chorus, which as you can see seems to be nearly exactly the la de da chorus. and then it sat there burning a hole in my shelf, as a ray of sunshine with a high standard i suppose i was afraid to live up to. fast forward to 2017, i've been actually recording songs, and videos of many different types, for many years at this point, and over the years the writing list had grown out of control, mostly from 2010 to 2013 but still even more later, so most of the time doing a song (recording + video) means going through the list and finding something i want to do. in post-hotewig i had made the decision to allow fragments to be picked (songs where only partial writing was done) so as to get something almost entirely new and finish the writing on the spot and record it. out of something like 400 to choose from, i manually got it down to about 41 finalists, planning to do a random number selection to choose. but i narrowed it down again manually to 27, and with agonizing fear i chose the number and it picked la de da. and then the next day i had terrible cold feet about it, thought it was lame and stupid. switched it to a slow song, switched it to another song, lost my mind, wasn't sure, and then somewhere around getting into the haircut chair (was planning on doing real video performance footage for this one) i was pondering a second verse after the bright la de da chorus, and the first 3 mall lines tumbled into my head quite readily. so at least that mostly solidified the song choice for me and gave it an extra push toward validity, and from there the decision was finalized and i quickly finished the writing and then went into production which took agonizingly long because it turns out going on camera in front of zillions of people can be scary if you haven't been doing it regularly

     Also, keep up the good work, I think 'Just did a bad thing' may be your best song yet.

     that is nice of you

of control, mostly from 2010 to 2013 but still even more later, so most of the time doing a song (recording + video) means going through the list and finding something i want to do. in post-hotewig i had made the decision to allow fragments to be picked (songs where only partial writing was done) so as to get something almost entirely new and finish the writing on the spot and record it. out of something like 400 to choose from, i manually got it down to about 41 finalists, planning to do a random number selection to choose. but i narrowed it down again manually to 27, and with agonizing fear i chose the number and it picked la de da. and then the next day i had terrible cold feet about it, thought it was lame and stupid. switched it to a slow song, switched it to another song, lost my mind, wasn't sure, and then somewhere around getting into the haircut chair (was planning on doing real video performance footage for this one) i was pondering a second verse after the bright la de da chorus, and the first 3 mall lines tumbled into my head quite readily. so at least that mostly solidified the song choice for me and gave it an extra push toward validity, and from there the decision was finalized and i quickly finished the writing and then went into production which took agonizingly long because it turns out going on camera in front of zillions of people can be scary if you haven't been doing it regularly

     Also, keep up the good work, I think 'Just did a bad thing' may be your best song yet.
